1561847632_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
Why you tell others what to do?
Even if "useless", if a person enjoys doing it or has meaning for them and them only, its fine. Otherwise, nothing is useful if its not feeling useful for that person doing it, be it a historian doing research, a religious person spending time doing what he believes in, a nurse caring for people, a farmer growing organic food, whatever...

1581083700_1CcmrTeqtuoQtUpuxBZ9wFZz1tPaB.body: To seed only selected channels, each channel would have to be its own hub i guess. Thats not really scalable and therefore not the case.
But you can control exactly which files you seed under ZN startpage - Files tab.

> [rannulfr](#comment_40_17ThiaUZmUKD2nEKkvUN6iCvaa1F3GBY51): Click the three stripes on the left on IFS.Select IFS Cluster 1Toggle "help distribute files" on the top right

That helps distribute all files from a cluster though, not a single channel. Not sure if only seed a single channel with current optional files and hubs system of ZN is possible.

1582060549_17ThiaUZmUKD2nEKkvUN6iCvaa1F3.body:
> [alfr](#comment_3_1LrW8M76omSeDjzbscCJUPndJuoYgQd626): yes of course. it works just like a torrent. videos that you open up start seeding automatically. if you go into the data folder for IFS you can delete them again.  [...]

You can also use the trashcan icon to remove it via frontend and prevent redownloading without explicit confirmation.

1582442446_1JmxhPt4FDP7rTmmaxoKdwTSDhwg5.body:
> [linuxsourced](#comment_5_1JmxhPt4FDP7rTmmaxoKdwTSDhwg5YSatG): Can you at least answer my question if there is  a way to stop zeronet from downloading sites to be used offline.

For ZN to grow with the central idea that whatever you visit gets redistributed, it imo needs an adblock-like system, where everyone can turn on/off what content type *you* like to be filtered out on *your* harddrive. For this to work, it needs to be built-in into ZNs core, but at the same time without centralized control like current zeroid, which is IP based from clearnet.

The key question then is:
How can it be prevented, if a user spams any file based zite which accepts contributions with a flood of (generated) files added to the system? Lets say a music zite or video zite or general zite be spammed with 100k files, all with different generated hash and lets say 1MB to 1 GB per file size?

Who can watch through this and remove all those fake, valueless files so they dont clog up any popular zite?

1583557114_129AZxKKZFQAyrSxv8ocZtZzPU1Gy.body: Why would you not release the code immediately? ZN is fully opensource, are you sure you dont breach the original license?

1584271096_1Ju57vNLWKmKJrp3DMy6W39Aq5pz9.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_1304_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): I'm wondering if anyone is working on a better video service?

To make a better service for videos or basically anything in ZN, we would need a global hashbased optional file system. A common filebase for data sharing, filehandling, filtering and deduplication is far more importand and missing at this point than current approach of a centralized, IP based user control system, which is controlled by a clearnet service one man show, which goes against anything ZN tries to solve in the first place.

1585399613_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body:
Very simple:
Tracking, blocking, censoring PEOPLE/ACCOUNTS is wrong and harmful. That only works on the clearnet, and needs registered and ip-based accounts, like cenzralized zeroid. That is wrong for ZN or any other decentralized network.

The correct approach is CONTENT based blocking, so any content is uniquly identified by hashsum, the centralized lists CAN be done like adbllockers, but no one is forced to use any or which ones.

The latter tracks data and offers choice, the former breaks ZN promise and tracks people by IP,  just like normal clearnet and makes ZN worthless.

I still wait for nofish to implement hashbased data optional files, that allow ZN-Wide identification and sorting of content/data, not people. Thats the only way to move forward and solve issue of every user decides by himself, what he/she wants or not.

1586599656_12DKigk2DkPNoUCFWcgzeW7CXu6kg.body: Does "TOR always" help with the trackers?

Agreeing on the critical points of ZN: Especially zeroid and duplication data. Both are related/dependent on each other: Since there is no unique identifiable DATA/ FILE sharing across ZN zites via hash / like ifps, zeroid is needed to keep spam/flooding under control via unique identifiable USER IDs. The reverse would be needed to have a breakthrough and solve both issues with one stone.

Btw. whats zerowiki based on?
So what else would need to be developed into ZN base other than true decentralized id system and data deduplication/sharing?

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_196_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): even Tor has a list of initial contact nodes / gateways.

Are those anonymized though or is your ISP assigned IP leaked/recorded on initial connect even when using TOR always?

1589783095_1H9xEgESUhfvpYK3SLLqabc1uLT2j.body: We need the universal file system in ZN. Otherwise it will be pointless having stuff scattered around small zites and endlessly trying to find what you search for. Without a universal file system, ZN and merger zites are doomed to fail as they never get past a certain point of scaling and keeping abuse in check.

> [xerog](#comment_43_1DWCrTtmJ1g3gLgwENAmzG75QvTkmjmoFv): All eggs in one basket?

No, all eggs shareable/manageable/filterable per users preference on any/all zites.

1591525925_14ADWoY886HnM8jPeipXarxAfyQAN.body:
> [frankwalter](#comment_1_18LjTpx4UtPSFfAZi8kfoyWasJq9gZCCkV): Adventure time and rick and morty. But please, don't do seeding with tor, it is against tor etiquette since the traffic is donated by volunteers and tor isn't for high bandwidth applications. You risk to saturate the network, seriously.

Thats not true and is even actively debunked by tor developers themselves on most conferences since a few years now. Also when two users use tor, it is only bridged, so no exit node is stressed at all.

1603608731_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body: ZN is basically dead as is, with one person making all the shots, or rather seems to have given up to do anything substantial needed (no, in its current form ZN will NEVER EVER have a breakthrough with the masses, no matter how bad or drastic the clearnet sucks).

> [zeroseed2](#comment_18_15ikhUiQxJkhNQuDUaR1RuUL45p5wq6Wtz): At first in my opinion we should create different forks of zerohello with more zites.

Very good point!
Since when did the inventor of the internet ALSO bothered with inventing facebook, spotify, youtube, etc. too?? Only because nofish has control over the main entry page, he shouldnt imo concentrate on promoting only his sites, this will (or is already) failing in the same way as AOL did...

Biggest thing that would make everyone switch or adopt open-ZN is a global opt-in blocklist for files. Therefore we need a global or universal filesystem, where a global filter (like adblocks lists) can be chosen to be applied and contributed to by any zn users.

Right now every zite needs to implement this on their own, it doesnt take care of missing files or redundant ones by using hashsums to organize optional files, etc. So a zite is still built by local code/files, but any user contributed content with optiinal files and hubs is organized in a global fashion via hashsums. Nofish never delivered this, andcitvis one of the absolute critical missing pieces for the 3 main reasons stated above (fixing redundancies, helping to provide missing files, allowing a global implemented, easy-to-use opt-in filterlist).

That added, I think people would feel a truly sense of ease help spreading new sites, curate content, having a sense that nothing ever gets lost in a non-repareable way as itvis now.

1610395383_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
> [bimmyql](#comment_41_1yhTF4WKRZsCBdVeh8fwPj14zAiEdtAXW): If it's possible to make cryptocurrencies that are resistant to manipulation, it should be possible to make an internet that works the same way, right? I'm really hoping this is one of the cases where there's a technological solution to a social problem.

Exactly this!
This is the holy grail and number one base requirement for a new internet.

Global Fileshare with universal adblock-like filter-lists is whats needed to protect major abuse. With a global filesystem shared by any zite, manipulation resistant file tagging would be built-in.

ZN has all the basics, though Nofish never followed up on this one and hence current ZN is way to easy to be manipulated or destroyed with bad content and hence lacks any real usage or mass adotption in its current state.

> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_764_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): @bimmyql you can block content from certain ids. You do the moderation yourself.

This is good, but only half step.

Imagine you work together and share a global filterlist, like adblock list:
You can then use same technology with multiple groups/factions, each having their own content/bubble IF they seek so themselves (not done by bots or algorythms), and without restricting or banning the other.

Any opinion or content can co-exist on same technology. 

people in their group/trust need only worry about their content and can mix and match whatever filtercombo they like (like no porn, no pepe, no "madonna" or other shit music, etc.) Neutral filterlists like "adfree" could be deployed by anyone, regardless of of other preferences.

Risks can then be mitigated and sharing of content happens only for what people really want/allow on their own harddrives.

This requires a global shared big file system, where filter-category is identified by unique hashsum for each file. That prevents blockage of e.g. marked spam-files zn-wide, just like adblocker on clearnet. 

Second benefit would be sharing of files zite-independent, so one can use any interface or zite for uploading and viewing, but neednt reupload if missing file is no longer available on first zite. E.g. a file uploaded and identified on one zite can be used to also seed from another zite, that reduces risk of 'empty/deprecated" 404 files greatly, plus avoids redundancy, also making storage effecient.

Imagine Zeronet becoming a true internet 2.0 with p2p and security measures built in and allowing any content be added, categorized and potentially "endlessly" stored without vanishing, censoring or manipulating.

Exchange of opinions for any content via comments, discussion, etc. can then happen without banning, but user controlled filter system.

Tldr; greatly functional P2p already there, easy scalable robustness/manipulation-resistance/protection only halfway.

> [unsnapgreedless](#comment_11_19XzssAaDbJ1rbCNCYxDioen1gxGxqiNyh): This is censorship.

Censorship is if someone else decides for you. Freedom is if you decide for yourself. So it is more freedom if I can decide to NOT view something for myself. Imagine the opposite is Alex forced open eyes in Clockwork orange.
